page.title: 08FARMING BURTON LAZARS
page.content: There are three main farms in Burton with stone houses and modern buildings around them.Two of them are small family farms to the West of the village and their fields are all grassland.These are used for grazing bullocks,sheep and lambs also cows and calves.Some grass is cut for haymaking in the summer,to be used for winter feed for the animals.One farm keeps pigs rearing piglets for pork and keeps hens for eggs.The third farm is a large arable farm called East farm to the East of the village,tenanted to a business man who grows corn to use in his breakfast cereal factory.He grows wheat,barley,oats and oil seed rape.The rape seed is used for margarine.This farm uses large machinery to do the work but only employs a small number of men.
